On Apr 16, 2010, at 6:47 PM, Tim Williams wrote:

> I've got a couple cases where important links that need to be machine
> readable don't necessarily have relationship that is easily qualified
> relative to the "current" resource - orthogonal links.  Since my
> representations of choice (e.g. xhtml) have a 'class' attribute on a
> link, I'm thinking of using that and having no [artificial] link
> relation.

The interpretation of the link would still be that the requested resource is the link source resource.

Why not embed some RDF?

Jan


>  The class attribute is intended to describe the "nature of
> the content" which seems to fit nicely in my scenario, but since
> they're typically used to drive CSS I feel a bit wonky doing so and
> wanted to get some validation.  So, thoughts?
